title: Crab Walking
text: Crabs typically walk and swim sideways due to the articulation of their legs, but true crabs are capable of moving in all directions!
author: CrabWalk

title: Crab Legs
text: Crabs are decapods, since they have 10 legs. The first pair of claws is called chela!
author: CrabLegs

title: Coconut Crab
text: The coconut crab is the largest land-dwelling crustacean in the world! They average up to 5 pounds in weight, although they can weigh up to 9, and have a leg span of 36 inches.
author: Coconut

title: Spider Crab Legends
text: Ancient mariner stories say that these crabs used to drag sailers overboard and eat them alive in the ocean!
author: ActualSpiderCrab

title: Hermit Crab Shell Sharing
text: When a new shell shows up, hermit crabs will line up from largest to smallest, and each will try the shell on until it fits!
author: HermitEnthusiast

title: Horseshoe Crab Anatomy
text: Horseshoe crabs have a tank-like structure consisting of a front shell (the prosoma), a back shell (the opisthosoma), and a spike-like tail (the telson)! They use their tail to flip over.
author: HorseshoeFan

title: hello
text: i am but a friendly post request
author: love me
